pullRequest.body:
- Changed existing proofs of some lemmas to avoid code duplication. Took out some common lines in their proofs and turned them into a lemma.
- `haarScalarFactor \mu \mu = 1`

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

Pull request successfully merged into master.

bors d+
Thanks!
This looks great, thanks!
Looks good, thanks!

bors d+
Thanks!

Is there a reason not to write this as
```suggestion
    {c : ℝ≥0} : haarScalarFactor (c • μ) μ = c := by
```

You're right :)
I changed the lemma to `haarScalarFactor (c • μ') μ = c • haarScalarFactor μ' μ` and 
`haarScalarFactor μ μ = 1` is now proved in a different way. These are both `simp`ed so the original lemma shouldn't really exist...
@eric-wieser

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [← haarScalarFactor_eq_integral_div _ _ g_cont g_comp int_g_ne_zero] ```

The file on Bochner integration is pretty heavy on imports (it needs a bunch of analysis), so one shouldn't import it in other files unless really necessary. Could you find another home for your lemmas?
How about just moving them to Bochner.lean?

@sgouezel I looked into it, and I couldn't find another file that is appropriate to these lemmas. I could move them to `Bochner.lean` but I think that would crowd it too much with topological imports. What do you think?

At least for the first lemma, I think all the topological imports are already there in `Bochner.lean`. So that looks like the right place for it. The second one could for instance go in `SetIntegral.lean`.
@sgouezel The second lemma doesn't talk about integrals on a subset, so I don't think `SetIntegral` is appropriate for it.

What really matters is to have a file with the right imports, and where it's not crazy to put your lemma in. `SetIntegral` corresponds rather closely to this description (there are several other lemmas in this file which are not talking about integrals on subsets, but whose proof uses lemmas on integrals on subsets, so you don't need a 100% correspondence with the theme of the file).
@sgouezel Very well. I've moved the lemmas. Does it look OK now?

```suggestion
  obtain ⟨⟨g, g_cont⟩, g_comp, g_nonneg, g_one⟩ :
    ∃ (g : C(G, ℝ)), HasCompactSupport g ∧ 0 ≤ g ∧ g 1 ≠ 0 := exists_continuous_nonneg_pos 1
  have int_g_pos : 0 < ∫ x, g x ∂μ :=
    g_cont.integral_pos_of_hasCompactSupport_nonneg_nonzero g_comp g_nonneg g_one
```
If a proof fits on one line, it's better to have it on one line than two as it's more readable.

```suggestion
  obtain ⟨⟨g, g_cont⟩, g_comp, g_nonneg, g_one⟩ :
    ∃ g : C(G, ℝ), HasCompactSupport g ∧ 0 ≤ g ∧ g 1 ≠ 0 := exists_continuous_nonneg_pos 1
  have int_g_pos : 0 < ∫ x, g x ∂μ' :=
    g_cont.integral_pos_of_hasCompactSupport_nonneg_nonzero g_comp g_nonneg g_one
```

```suggestion
  obtain ⟨⟨g, g_cont⟩, g_comp, g_nonneg, g_one⟩ :
    ∃ g : C(G, ℝ), HasCompactSupport g ∧ 0 ≤ g ∧ g 1 ≠ 0 := exists_continuous_nonneg_pos 1
  have int_g_ne_zero : ∫ x, g x ∂μ ≠ 0 :=
    ne_of_gt (g_cont.integral_pos_of_hasCompactSupport_nonneg_nonzero g_comp g_nonneg g_one)
```

```suggestion
  obtain ⟨⟨g, g_cont⟩, g_comp, g_nonneg, g_one⟩ :
    ∃ g : C(G, ℝ), HasCompactSupport g ∧ 0 ≤ g ∧ g 1 ≠ 0 := exists_continuous_nonneg_pos 1
  have int_g_ne_zero : ∫ x, g x ∂μ ≠ 0 :=
    ne_of_gt (g_cont.integral_pos_of_hasCompactSupport_nonneg_nonzero g_comp g_nonneg g_one)
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion haarScalarFactor μ μ = 1 := by ```

```suggestion
    0 < ∫ x, f x ∂μ :=
  (integral_pos_iff_support_of_nonneg f_nonneg f_int).2
    (IsOpen.measure_pos μ f_cont.isOpen_support ⟨x, f_x⟩)
```
If the proof doesn't fit on one line, it's better to separate it clearly from the statement.

```suggestion
    (f_x : f x ≠ 0) : 0 < ∫ x, f x ∂μ :=
  f_cont.integral_pos_of_integrable_nonneg_nonzero
    (f_cont.integrable_of_hasCompactSupport f_comp) f_nonneg f_x
```
I think I prefer the previous spacing.
I still think I prefer the previous spacing. Could you please revert your change here?
